Installing BrianQC¶; Please contact BrianQC at https://brianqc.com/; to download the BrianQC GPU module and obtain a license.; Note that there are several prerequisites for using BrianQC, including; having a supported GPU available in the computing node and having the; proper GPU drivers installed. Please refer to the BrianQC manual; for a full list of prerequisites.; When installing BrianQC, choose the SDK installation by setting the; BRIANQC_SDK_INSTALL envoronment variable to 1. Building BrianQC’s user-built components¶; After the installation, build BrianQC’s example and sample programs,; which also creates the wrapper library and CMake configuration files; required to build PSI4 with BrianQC. Create a build directory to keep the source tree clean. cd <brianqc_install_path>; mkdir build; cd build. Configure project and generate makefiles with CMake.; You will require Eigen (tested with version 3.1.2); and boost (tested with version 1.62). cmake .. Build the examples and samples. make. Test the installation by starting a small calculation.; Make sure to set the BRIANQC_INSTALL_PATH environment variable to <brianqc_install_path>!. export BRIANQC_INSTALL_PATH=<brianqc_install_path>; bin/sample_hf_and_dft --molecule ../share/qc_molecules/cis-decalin.raw --basis ../share/basis_sets/cc-pvdz. Building PSI4 with BrianQC¶; When CMake-ing PSI4, set the ENABLE_BrianQC CMake variable to 1; and set the BrianQC_DIR CMake variable to the path where BrianQC’s; components have been built (usually <brianqc_install_path>/build), then build PSI4 normally. Using BrianQC from PSI4¶; To u

Please refer to the BrianQC manual; for a full list of prerequisites.; When installing BrianQC, choose the SDK installation by setting the; BRIANQC_SDK_INSTALL envoronment variable to 1. Building BrianQC’s user-built components¶; After the installation, build BrianQC’s example and sample programs,; which also creates the wrapper library and CMake configuration files; required to build PSI4 with BrianQC. Create a build directory to keep the source tree clean. cd <brianqc_install_path>; mkdir build; cd build. Configure project and generate makefiles with CMake.; You will require Eigen (tested with version 3.1.2); and boost (tested with version 1.62). cmake .. Build the examples and samples. make. Test the installation by starting a small calculation.; Make sure to set the BRIANQC_INSTALL_PATH environment variable to <brianqc_install_path>!. export BRIANQC_INSTALL_PATH=<brianqc_install_path>; bin/sample_hf_and_dft --molecule ../share/qc_molecules/cis-decalin.raw --basis ../share/basis_sets/cc-pvdz. Using BrianQC from PSI4¶; To use BrianQC, the BRIANQC_INSTALL_PATH environment variable; must be set to the full path of your BrianQC installation.; There are two ways to enable BrianQC for a specific calculation:. setting the BRIANQC_ENABLE input option to True;; setting the BRIANQC_ENABLE environment variable to 1. sentence: and CMake configuration files; required to build PSI4 with BrianQC. Create a build directory to keep the source tree clean. cd <brianqc_install_path>; mkdir build; cd build. Configure project and generate makefiles with CMake.; You will require Eigen (tested with version 3.1.2); and boost (tested with version 1.62). cmake .. Build the examples and samples. make. Test the installation by starting a small calculation.; Make sure to set the BRIANQC_INSTALL_PATH environment variable to <brianqc_install_path>!. export BRIANQC_INSTALL_PATH=<brianqc_install_path>; bin/sample_hf_and_dft --molecule ../share/qc_molecules/cis-decalin.raw --basis ../share/basis_sets/cc-pvdz. Building PSI4 with BrianQC¶; When CMake-ing PSI4, set the ENABLE_BrianQC CMake variable to 1; and set the BrianQC_DIR CMake variable to the path where BrianQC’s; components have been built (usually <brianqc_install_path>/build), then build PSI4 normally. Using BrianQC from PSI4¶; To use BrianQC, the BRIANQC_INSTALL_PATH environment variable; must be set to the full path of your BrianQC installation.; There are two ways to enable BrianQC for a specific calculation:. setting the BRIANQC_ENABLE input option to True;; setting the BRIANQC_ENABLE environment variable to 1. If both the input option and the environment variable are specified,; then the environment variable takes precedence. When to enable BrianQC¶; The operation of BrianQC is transparent from a user’s point of view; every; internal computation is either performed by PSI4 (if unsupported by BrianQC),; or taken over by BrianQC, yielding the same result to within the required; precision. In particular, BrianQC will respect all of PSI4’s usual precision; parameters, like INTS_TOLERANCE and E_CONVERGENCE.; BrianQC can speed up a number of internal computations, including Fock and; gradient computation. Thus, BrianQC will speed up any calculation involving; those terms, such as. HF and DFT single point energies; HF and DFT geometry optimizations; HF and
author: psi4

sentence: ; To ensure that a calculation works with BrianQC, the following options need to; be set when enabling BrianQC:. BrianQC currently only handles the C1 molecular symmetry point group. Thus, if; the molecule has any symmetries (which PSI4 would detect by default), the; input geometry must contain the line symmetry c1 to force PSI4 to; disregard the symmetry. To achieve peak performance, the following settings are recommended when enabling; BrianQC:. By default, PSI4 uses density-fitted preiterations for SCF, which BrianQC; doesn’t handle yet. To ensure that no non-BrianQC-accelerated iterations are; performed, disable the preiterations by setting DF_SCF_GUESS to False.; By default, PSI4 uses a disk-based Fock building, but BrianQC currently only; accelerates direct Fock builds. To ensure that Fock building is accelerated by; BrianQC, set SCF_TYPE to direct. Keywords¶. BRIANQC_ENABLE¶. Whether to enable using the BrianQC GPU module. Type: boolean; Default: false. Environment Variables¶. BRIANQC_SDK_INSTALL¶; Toggle for type of BrianQC installation.; See https://s3.amazonaws.com/streamnovation-brianqc-manual/BrianQC_Manual_v1_1_0.pdf for details. BRIANQC_INSTALL_PATH¶; Location of BrianQC installation.; See https://s3.amazonaws.com/streamnovation-brianqc-manual/BrianQC_Manual_v1_1_0.pdf for details. BRIANQC_ENABLE¶; Runtime toggle of whether to use BrianQC. table of contents. Interface to the BrianQC GPU module by the BrianQC team; Installing BrianQC; Building BrianQC’s user-built components; Building PSI4 with BrianQC; Using BrianQC from PSI4; When to enable BrianQC; Necessary and recommended option values. Installing BrianQC¶; Please contact BrianQC at https://brianqc.com/; to download the BrianQC GPU module and obtain a license.; Note that there are several prerequisites for using BrianQC, including; having a supported GPU available in the computing node and having the; proper GPU drivers installed. Please refer to the BrianQC manual; for a full list of prerequisites.; When installing BrianQC, choose the SDK installation by setting the; BRIANQC_SDK_INSTALL envoronment variable to 1. Building BrianQC’s user-built components¶; After the installation, build BrianQC’s example and sample programs,; which also creates the wrapper library and CMake configuration files; required to build PSI4 with BrianQC. Create a build directory to keep the source tree clean. cd <brianqc_install_path>; mkdir build; cd build. Configure project and generate makefiles with CMake.; You will require Eigen (tested with version 3.1.2); and boost (tested with version 1.62). cmake .. Build the examples and samples. make. Test the installation by starting a small calculation.; Make sure to set the BRIANQC_INSTALL_PATH environment variable to <brianqc_install_path>!. export BRIANQC_INSTALL_PATH=<brianqc_install_path>; bin/sample_hf_and_dft --molecule ../share/qc_molecules/cis-decalin.raw --basis ../share/basis_sets/cc-pvdz. Building PSI4 with BrianQC¶; When CMake-ing PSI4, set the ENABLE_BrianQC CMake variable to 1; and set the BrianQC_DIR CMake variable to the path where BrianQC’s; components have been built

sentence: to enable BrianQC for a specific calculation:. setting the BRIANQC_ENABLE input option to True;; setting the BRIANQC_ENABLE environment variable to 1. If both the input option and the environment variable are specified,; then the environment variable takes precedence. When to enable BrianQC¶; The operation of BrianQC is transparent from a user’s point of view; every; internal computation is either performed by PSI4 (if unsupported by BrianQC),; or taken over by BrianQC, yielding the same result to within the required; precision. In particular, BrianQC will respect all of PSI4’s usual precision; parameters, like INTS_TOLERANCE and E_CONVERGENCE.; BrianQC can speed up a number of internal computations, including Fock and; gradient computation. Thus, BrianQC will speed up any calculation involving; those terms, such as. HF and DFT single point energies; HF and DFT geometry optimizations; HF and DFT frequency analysis. Note that not every term of every calculation can be handled by BrianQC, thus,; the actual speedup depends on the specifics of the calculation. Necessary and recommended option values¶; To ensure that a calculation works with BrianQC, the following options need to; be set when enabling BrianQC:. BrianQC currently only handles the C1 molecular symmetry point group. Thus, if; the molecule has any symmetries (which PSI4 would detect by default), the; input geometry must contain the line symmetry c1 to force PSI4 to; disregard the symmetry. To achieve peak performance, the following settings are recommended when enabling; BrianQC:. By default, PSI4 uses density-fitted preiterations for SCF, which BrianQC; doesn’t handle yet. To ensure that no non-BrianQC-accelerated iterations are; performed, disable the preiterations by setting DF_SCF_GUESS to False.; By default, PSI4 uses a disk-based Fock building, but BrianQC currently only; accelerates direct Fock builds. To ensure that Fock building is accelerated by; BrianQC, set SCF_TYPE to direct. Keywords¶. BRIANQC_

sentence: e; BRIANQC_SDK_INSTALL envoronment variable to 1. Building BrianQC’s user-built components¶; After the installation, build BrianQC’s example and sample programs,; which also creates the wrapper library and CMake configuration files; required to build PSI4 with BrianQC. Create a build directory to keep the source tree clean. cd <brianqc_install_path>; mkdir build; cd build. Configure project and generate makefiles with CMake.; You will require Eigen (tested with version 3.1.2); and boost (tested with version 1.62). cmake .. Build the examples and samples. make. Test the installation by starting a small calculation.; Make sure to set the BRIANQC_INSTALL_PATH environment variable to <brianqc_install_path>!. export BRIANQC_INSTALL_PATH=<brianqc_install_path>; bin/sample_hf_and_dft --molecule ../share/qc_molecules/cis-decalin.raw --basis ../share/basis_sets/cc-pvdz. Building PSI4 with BrianQC¶; When CMake-ing PSI4, set the ENABLE_BrianQC CMake variable to 1; and set the BrianQC_DIR CMake variable to the path where BrianQC’s; components have been built (usually <brianqc_install_path>/build), then build PSI4 normally. Using BrianQC from PSI4¶; To use BrianQC, the BRIANQC_INSTALL_PATH environment variable; must be set to the full path of your BrianQC installation.; There are two ways to enable BrianQC for a specific calculation:. setting the BRIANQC_ENABLE input option to True;; setting the BRIANQC_ENABLE environment variable to 1. If both the input option and the environment variable are specified,; then the environment variable takes precedence. When to enable BrianQC¶; The operation of BrianQC is transparent from a user’s point of view; every; internal computation is either performed by PSI4 (if unsupported by BrianQC),; or taken over by BrianQC, yielding the same result to within the required; precision. In particular, BrianQC will respect all of PSI4’s usual precision; parameters, like INTS_TOLERANCE and E_CONVERGENCE.; BrianQC can speed up a number of internal computat

Test the installation by starting a small calculation.; Make sure to set the BRIANQC_INSTALL_PATH environment variable to <brianqc_install_path>!. export BRIANQC_INSTALL_PATH=<brianqc_install_path>; bin/sample_hf_and_dft --molecule ../share/qc_molecules/cis-decalin.raw --basis ../share/basis_sets/cc-pvdz. Building PSI4 with BrianQC¶; When CMake-ing PSI4, set the ENABLE_BrianQC CMake variable to 1; and set the BrianQC_DIR CMake variable to the path where BrianQC’s; components have been built (usually <brianqc_install_path>/build), then build PSI4 normally. Using BrianQC from PSI4¶; To use BrianQC, the BRIANQC_INSTALL_PATH environment variable; must be set to the full path of your BrianQC installation.; There are two ways to enable BrianQC for a specific calculation:. setting the BRIANQC_ENABLE input option to True;; setting the BRIANQC_ENABLE environment variable to 1. If both the input option and the environment variable are specified,; then the environment variable takes precedence. When to enable BrianQC¶; The operation of BrianQC is transparent from a user’s point of view; every; internal computation is either performed by PSI4 (if unsupported by BrianQC),; or taken over by BrianQC, yielding the same result to within the required; precision. In particular, BrianQC will respect all of PSI4’s usual precision; parameters, like INTS_TOLERANCE and E_CONVERGENCE.; BrianQC can speed up a number of internal computations, including Fock and; gradient computation. Thus, BrianQC will speed up any calculation involving; those terms, such as. HF and DFT single point energies; HF and DFT geometry optimizations; HF and DFT frequency analysis. Note that not every term of every calculation can be handled by BrianQC, thus,; the actual speedup depends on the specifics of the calculation. Necessary and recommended

author: psi4

sentence: BRIANQC_INSTALL_PATH environment variable; must be set to the full path of your BrianQC installation.; There are two ways to enable BrianQC for a specific calculation:. setting the BRIANQC_ENABLE input option to True;; setting the BRIANQC_ENABLE environment variable to 1. If both the input option and the environment variable are specified,; then the environment variable takes precedence. When to enable BrianQC¶; The operation of BrianQC is transparent from a user’s point of view; every; internal computation is either performed by PSI4 (if unsupported by BrianQC),; or taken over by BrianQC, yielding the same result to within the required; precision. In particular, BrianQC will respect all of PSI4’s usual precision; parameters, like INTS_TOLERANCE and E_CONVERGENCE.; BrianQC can speed up a number of internal computations, including Fock and; gradient computation. Thus, BrianQC will speed up any calculation involving; those terms, such as. HF and DFT single point energies; HF and DFT geometry optimizations; HF and DFT frequency analysis. Note that not every term of every calculation can be handled by BrianQC, thus,; the actual speedup depends on the specifics of the calculation. Necessary and recommended option values¶; To ensure that a calculation works with BrianQC, the following options need to; be set when enabling BrianQC:. BrianQC currently only handles the C1 molecular symmetry point group. Thus, if; the molecule has any symmetries (which PSI4 would detect by default), the; input geometry must contain the line symmetry c1 to force PSI4 to; disregard the symmetry. To achieve peak performance, the following settings are recommended when enabling; BrianQC:. By default, PSI4 uses density-fitted preiterations for SCF, which BrianQC; doesn’t handle yet. To ensure that no non-BrianQC-accelerated iterations are; performed, disable the preiterations by setting DF_SCF_GUESS to False.; By default, PSI4 uses a disk-based Fock building, but BrianQC currently only; accelerate
author: psi4

sentence: uired; precision. In particular, BrianQC will respect all of PSI4’s usual precision; parameters, like INTS_TOLERANCE and E_CONVERGENCE.; BrianQC can speed up a number of internal computations, including Fock and; gradient computation. Thus, BrianQC will speed up any calculation involving; those terms, such as. HF and DFT single point energies; HF and DFT geometry optimizations; HF and DFT frequency analysis. Note that not every term of every calculation can be handled by BrianQC, thus,; the actual speedup depends on the specifics of the calculation. Necessary and recommended option values¶; To ensure that a calculation works with BrianQC, the following options need to; be set when enabling BrianQC:. BrianQC currently only handles the C1 molecular symmetry point group. Thus, if; the molecule has any symmetries (which PSI4 would detect by default), the; input geometry must contain the line symmetry c1 to force PSI4 to; disregard the symmetry. To achieve peak performance, the following settings are recommended when enabling; BrianQC:. By default, PSI4 uses density-fitted preiterations for SCF, which BrianQC; doesn’t handle yet. To ensure that no non-BrianQC-accelerated iterations are; performed, disable the preiterations by setting DF_SCF_GUESS to False.; By default, PSI4 uses a disk-based Fock building, but BrianQC currently only; accelerates direct Fock builds. To ensure that Fock building is accelerated by; BrianQC, set SCF_TYPE to direct. Keywords¶. BRIANQC_ENABLE¶. Whether to enable using the BrianQC GPU module. Type: boolean; Default: false. Environment Variables¶. BRIANQC_SDK_INSTALL¶; Toggle for type of BrianQC installation.; See https://s3.amazonaws.com/streamnovation-brianqc-manual/BrianQC_Manual_v1_1_0.pdf for details. BRIANQC_INSTALL_PATH¶; Location of BrianQC installation.; See https://s3.amazonaws.com/streamnovation-brianqc-manual/BrianQC_Manual_v1_1_0.pdf for details. BRIANQC_ENABLE¶; Runtime toggle of whether to use BrianQC. table of contents. Interface

To ensure that no non-BrianQC-accelerated iterations are; performed, disable the preiterations by setting DF_SCF_GUESS to False.; By default, PSI4 uses a disk-based Fock building, but BrianQC currently only; accelerates direct Fock builds. Installing BrianQC¶; Please contact BrianQC at https://brianqc.com/; to download the BrianQC GPU module and obtain a license.; Note that there are several prerequisites for using BrianQC, including; having a supported GPU available in the computing node and having the; proper GPU drivers installed. Please refer to the BrianQC manual; for a full list of prerequisites.; When installing BrianQC, choose the SDK installation by setting the; BRIANQC_SDK_INSTALL envoronment variable to 1. Interfaces: Enhancing PSI4 Capabilities; Interface to the BrianQC GPU module by the BrianQC team. Interface to the BrianQC GPU module by the BrianQC team¶; Code author: Gergely Kis; Section author: Gergely Kis; PSI4 contains code to interface to the BrianQC GPU module developed; by the BrianQC team, which is available after a license agreement from; https://brianqc.com/. Installing BrianQC¶; Please contact BrianQC at https://brianqc.com/; to download the BrianQC GPU module and obtain a license.; Note that there are several prerequisites for using BrianQC, including; having a supported GPU available in the computing node and having the; proper GPU drivers installed. Please refer to the BrianQC manual; for a full list of prerequisites.; When installing BrianQC, choose the SDK installation by setting the; BRIANQC_SDK_INSTALL envoronment variable to 1. Building BrianQC’s user-built components¶; After the installation, build BrianQC’s example and sample programs,; which also creates the wrapper library and CMake configuration files; required to build PSI4 with BrianQC. Create a build directory to keep the source tree clean. cd <brianqc_install_path>; mkdir build; cd build. Configure project and generate makefiles with CMake.; You will require Eigen (tested with version 3.1.2); and boost (tested with version 1.62). cmake .. Build the examples and samples. make. Test the installation by starting a small calculation.; Make sure to set the BRIANQC_INSTALL_PATH environment variable to <brianqc_install_path>!. export BRIANQC_INSTALL_PATH=<brianqc_install_path>; bin/sample_hf_and_dft --molecule ../share/qc_molecules/cis-decalin.raw --basis ../share/basis_sets/cc-pvdz. Building PSI4 with BrianQC¶; When CMake-ing PSI4, set the ENABLE_BrianQC CMake variable to 1; and set the BrianQC_DIR CMake variable to the path where BrianQC’s; components have been built
author: psi4

Create a build directory to keep the source tree clean. cd <brianqc_install_path>; mkdir build; cd build. Configure project and generate makefiles with CMake.; You will require Eigen (tested with version 3.1.2); and boost (tested with version 1.62). cmake .. Build the examples and samples. make. Test the installation by starting a small calculation.; Make sure to set the BRIANQC_INSTALL_PATH environment variable to <brianqc_install_path>!. export BRIANQC_INSTALL_PATH=<brianqc_install_path>; bin/sample_hf_and_dft --molecule ../share/qc_molecules/cis-decalin.raw --basis ../share/basis_sets/cc-pvdz. Building PSI4 with BrianQC¶; When CMake-ing PSI4, set the ENABLE_BrianQC CMake variable to 1; and set the BrianQC_DIR CMake variable to the path where BrianQC’s; components have been built

sentence: ntact BrianQC at https://brianqc.com/; to download the BrianQC GPU module and obtain a license.; Note that there are several prerequisites for using BrianQC, including; having a supported GPU available in the computing node and having the; proper GPU drivers installed. Please refer to the BrianQC manual; for a full list of prerequisites.; When installing BrianQC, choose the SDK installation by setting the; BRIANQC_SDK_INSTALL envoronment variable to 1. Building BrianQC’s user-built components¶; After the installation, build BrianQC’s example and sample programs,; which also creates the wrapper library and CMake configuration files; required to build PSI4 with BrianQC. Create a build directory to keep the source tree clean. cd <brianqc_install_path>; mkdir build; cd build. Configure project and generate makefiles with CMake.; You will require Eigen (tested with version 3.1.2); and boost (tested with version 1.62). cmake .. Build the examples and samples. make. Test the installation by starting a small calculation.; Make sure to set the BRIANQC_INSTALL_PATH environment variable to <brianqc_install_path>!. export BRIANQC_INSTALL_PATH=<brianqc_install_path>; bin/sample_hf_and_dft --molecule ../share/qc_molecules/cis-decalin.raw --basis ../share/basis_sets/cc-pvdz. Building PSI4 with BrianQC¶; When CMake-ing PSI4, set the ENABLE_BrianQC CMake variable to 1; and set the BrianQC_DIR CMake variable to the path where BrianQC’s; components have been built (usually <brianqc_install_path>/build), then build PSI4 normally. Using BrianQC from PSI4¶; To use BrianQC, the BRIANQC_INSTALL_PATH environment variable; must be set to the full path of your BrianQC installation.; There are two ways to enable BrianQC for a specific calculation:. setting the BRIANQC_ENABLE input option to True;; setting the BRIANQC_ENABLE environment variable to 1. If both the input option and the environment variable are specified,; then the environment variable takes precedence. When to enable BrianQC¶; The

sentence: and CMake configuration files; required to build PSI4 with BrianQC. Create a build directory to keep the source tree clean. cd <brianqc_install_path>; mkdir build; cd build. Configure project and generate makefiles with CMake.; You will require Eigen (tested with version 3.1.2); and boost (tested with version 1.62). cmake .. Build the examples and samples. make. Test the installation by starting a small calculation.; Make sure to set the BRIANQC_INSTALL_PATH environment variable to <brianqc_install_path>!. export BRIANQC_INSTALL_PATH=<brianqc_install_path>; bin/sample_hf_and_dft --molecule ../share/qc_molecules/cis-decalin.raw --basis ../share/basis_sets/cc-pvdz. Building PSI4 with BrianQC¶; When CMake-ing PSI4, set the ENABLE_BrianQC CMake variable to 1; and set the BrianQC_DIR CMake variable to the path where BrianQC’s; components have been built (usually <brianqc_install_path>/build), then build PSI4 normally. Using BrianQC from PSI4¶; To use BrianQC, the BRIANQC_INSTALL_PATH environment variable; must be set to the full path of your BrianQC installation.; There are two ways to enable BrianQC for a specific calculation:. setting the BRIANQC_ENABLE input option to True;; setting the BRIANQC_ENABLE environment variable to 1. If both the input option and the environment variable are specified,; then the environment variable takes precedence. When to enable BrianQC¶; The operation of BrianQC is transparent from a user’s point of view; every; internal computation is either performed by PSI4 (if unsupported by BrianQC),; or taken over by BrianQC, yielding the same result to within the required; precision. In particular, BrianQC will respect all of PSI4’s usual precision; parameters, like INTS_TOLERANCE and E_CONVERGENCE.; BrianQC can speed up a number of internal computations, including Fock and; gradient computation. Thus, BrianQC will speed up any calculation involving; those terms, such as. HF and DFT single point energies; HF and DFT geometry optimizations; HF and
author: psi4

sentence: ; To ensure that a calculation works with BrianQC, the following options need to; be set when enabling BrianQC:. BrianQC currently only handles the C1 molecular symmetry point group. Thus, if; the molecule has any symmetries (which PSI4 would detect by default), the; input geometry must contain the line symmetry c1 to force PSI4 to; disregard the symmetry. To achieve peak performance, the following settings are recommended when enabling; BrianQC:. By default, PSI4 uses density-fitted preiterations for SCF, which BrianQC; doesn’t handle yet. To ensure that no non-BrianQC-accelerated iterations are; performed, disable the preiterations by setting DF_SCF_GUESS to False.; By default, PSI4 uses a disk-based Fock building, but BrianQC currently only; accelerates direct Fock builds. To ensure that Fock building is accelerated by; BrianQC, set SCF_TYPE to direct. Keywords¶. BRIANQC_ENABLE¶. Whether to enable using the BrianQC GPU module. Type: boolean; Default: false. Environment Variables¶. BRIANQC_SDK_INSTALL¶; Toggle for type of BrianQC installation.; See https://s3.amazonaws.com/streamnovation-brianqc-manual/BrianQC_Manual_v1_1_0.pdf for details. BRIANQC_INSTALL_PATH¶; Location of BrianQC installation.; See https://s3.amazonaws.com/streamnovation-brianqc-manual/BrianQC_Manual_v1_1_0.pdf for details. BRIANQC_ENABLE¶; Runtime toggle of whether to use BrianQC. table of contents. Interface to the BrianQC GPU module by the BrianQC team; Installing BrianQC; Building BrianQC’s user-built components; Building PSI4 with BrianQC; Using BrianQC from PSI4; When to enable BrianQC; Necessary and recommended option values. Building BrianQC’s user-built components¶; After the installation, build BrianQC’s example and sample programs,; which also creates the wrapper library and CMake configuration files; required to build PSI4 with BrianQC. sentence: to enable BrianQC for a specific calculation:. setting the BRIANQC_ENABLE input option to True;; setting the BRIANQC_ENABLE environment variable to 1. If both the input option and the environment variable are specified,; then the environment variable takes precedence. When to enable BrianQC¶; The operation of BrianQC is transparent from a user’s point of view; every; internal computation is either performed by PSI4 (if unsupported by BrianQC),; or taken over by BrianQC, yielding the same result to within the required; precision. In particular, BrianQC will respect all of PSI4’s usual precision; parameters, like INTS_TOLERANCE and E_CONVERGENCE.; BrianQC can speed up a number of internal computations, including Fock and; gradient computation. Thus, BrianQC will speed up any calculation involving; those terms, such as. HF and DFT single point energies; HF and DFT geometry optimizations; HF and DFT frequency analysis. Note that not every term of every calculation can be handled by BrianQC, thus,; the actual speedup depends on the specifics of the calculation. Necessary and recommended option values¶; To ensure that a calculation works with BrianQC, the following options need to; be set when enabling BrianQC:. BrianQC currently only handles the C1 molecular symmetry point group. Thus, if; the molecule has any symmetries (which PSI4 would detect by default), the; input geometry must contain the line symmetry c1 to force PSI4 to; disregard the symmetry. To achieve peak performance, the following settings are recommended when enabling; BrianQC:. By default, PSI4 uses density-fitted preiterations for SCF, which BrianQC; doesn’t handle yet. To ensure that no non-BrianQC-accelerated iterations are; performed, disable the preiterations by setting DF_SCF_GUESS to False.; By default, PSI4 uses a disk-based Fock building, but BrianQC currently only; accelerates direct Fock builds. To ensure that Fock building is accelerated by; BrianQC, set SCF_TYPE to direct. Keywords¶. BRIANQC_

Create a build directory to keep the source tree clean. cd <brianqc_install_path>; mkdir build; cd build. Configure project and generate makefiles with CMake.; You will require Eigen (tested with version 3.1.2); and boost (tested with version 1.62). cmake .. Build the examples and samples. make. Test the installation by starting a small calculation.; Make sure to set the BRIANQC_INSTALL_PATH environment variable to <brianqc_install_path>!. export BRIANQC_INSTALL_PATH=<brianqc_install_path>; bin/sample_hf_and_dft --molecule ../share/qc_molecules/cis-decalin.raw --basis ../share/basis_sets/cc-pvdz. Building PSI4 with BrianQC¶; When CMake-ing PSI4, set the ENABLE_BrianQC CMake variable to 1; and set the BrianQC_DIR CMake variable to the path where BrianQC’s; components have been built
author: psi4

sentence: .    .  · ; 1.4;  · . PSI4. Interfaces: Enhancing PSI4 Capabilities; Interface to the BrianQC GPU module by the BrianQC team. Interface to the BrianQC GPU module by the BrianQC team¶; Code author: Gergely Kis; Section author: Gergely Kis; PSI4 contains code to interface to the BrianQC GPU module developed; by the BrianQC team, which is available after a license agreement from; https://brianqc.com/. Installing BrianQC¶; Please contact BrianQC at https://brianqc.com/; to download the BrianQC GPU module and obtain a license.; Note that there are several prerequisites for using BrianQC, including; having a supported GPU available in the computing node and having the; proper GPU drivers installed. Please refer to the BrianQC manual; for a full list of prerequisites.; When installing BrianQC, choose the SDK installation by setting the; BRIANQC_SDK_INSTALL envoronment variable to 1. Building BrianQC’s user-built components¶; After the installation, build BrianQC’s example and sample programs,; which also creates the wrapper library and CMake configuration files; required to build PSI4 with BrianQC. Create a build directory to keep the source tree clean. cd <brianqc_install_path>; mkdir build; cd build. Configure project and generate makefiles with CMake.; You will require Eigen (tested with version 3.1.2); and boost (tested with version 1.62). cmake .. Build the examples and samples. make. Test the installation by starting a small calculation.; Make sure to set the BRIANQC_INSTALL_PATH environment variable to <brianqc_install_path>!. export BRIANQC_INSTALL_PATH=<brianqc_install_path>; bin/sample_hf_and_dft --molecule ../share/qc_molecules/cis-decalin.raw --basis ../share/basis_sets/cc-pvdz. Building PSI4 with BrianQC¶; When CMake-ing PSI4, set the ENABLE_BrianQC CMake variable to 1; and set the BrianQC_DIR CMake variable to the path where BrianQC’s; components have been built (usually <brianqc_install_path>/build), then build PSI4 normally. Using BrianQC from PSI4¶; To u

Building PSI4 with BrianQC¶; When CMake-ing PSI4, set the ENABLE_BrianQC CMake variable to 1; and set the BrianQC_DIR CMake variable to the path where BrianQC’s; components have been built (usually <brianqc_install_path>/build), then build PSI4 normally. Using BrianQC from PSI4¶; To use BrianQC, the BRIANQC_INSTALL_PATH environment variable; must be set to the full path of your BrianQC installation.; There are two ways to enable BrianQC for a specific calculation:. setting the BRIANQC_ENABLE input option to True;; setting the BRIANQC_ENABLE environment variable to 1. Test the installation by starting a small calculation.; Make sure to set the BRIANQC_INSTALL_PATH environment variable to <brianqc_install_path>!. export BRIANQC_INSTALL_PATH=<brianqc_install_path>; bin/sample_hf_and_dft --molecule ../share/qc_molecules/cis-decalin.raw --basis ../share/basis_sets/cc-pvdz. Building PSI4 with BrianQC¶; When CMake-ing PSI4, set the ENABLE_BrianQC CMake variable to 1; and set the BrianQC_DIR CMake variable to the path where BrianQC’s; components have been built (usually <brianqc_install_path>/build), then build PSI4 normally. Using BrianQC from PSI4¶; To use BrianQC, the BRIANQC_INSTALL_PATH environment variable; must be set to the full path of your BrianQC installation.; There are two ways to enable BrianQC for a specific calculation:. setting the BRIANQC_ENABLE input option to True;; setting the BRIANQC_ENABLE environment variable to 1. If both the input option and the environment variable are specified,; then the environment variable takes precedence. When to enable BrianQC¶; The operation of BrianQC is transparent from a user’s point of view; every; internal computation is either performed by PSI4 (if unsupported by BrianQC),; or taken over by BrianQC, yielding the same result to within the required; precision. In particular, BrianQC will respect all of PSI4’s usual precision; parameters, like INTS_TOLERANCE and E_CONVERGENCE.; BrianQC can speed up a number of internal computations, including Fock and; gradient computation. Thus, BrianQC will speed up any calculation involving; those terms, such as. HF and DFT single point energies; HF and DFT geometry optimizations; HF and DFT frequency analysis. Note that not every term of every calculation can be handled by BrianQC, thus,; the actual speedup depends on the specifics of the calculation. Necessary and recommended

If both the input option and the environment variable are specified,; then the environment variable takes precedence. In particular, BrianQC will respect all of PSI4’s usual precision; parameters, like INTS_TOLERANCE and E_CONVERGENCE.; BrianQC can speed up a number of internal computations, including Fock and; gradient computation. author: psi4

sentence: BRIANQC_INSTALL_PATH environment variable; must be set to the full path of your BrianQC installation.; There are two ways to enable BrianQC for a specific calculation:. setting the BRIANQC_ENABLE input option to True;; setting the BRIANQC_ENABLE environment variable to 1. If both the input option and the environment variable are specified,; then the environment variable takes precedence. When to enable BrianQC¶; The operation of BrianQC is transparent from a user’s point of view; every; internal computation is either performed by PSI4 (if unsupported by BrianQC),; or taken over by BrianQC, yielding the same result to within the required; precision. In particular, BrianQC will respect all of PSI4’s usual precision; parameters, like INTS_TOLERANCE and E_CONVERGENCE.; BrianQC can speed up a number of internal computations, including Fock and; gradient computation. Thus, BrianQC will speed up any calculation involving; those terms, such as. HF and DFT single point energies; HF and DFT geometry optimizations; HF and DFT frequency analysis. Note that not every term of every calculation can be handled by BrianQC, thus,; the actual speedup depends on the specifics of the calculation. Necessary and recommended option values¶; To ensure that a calculation works with BrianQC, the following options need to; be set when enabling BrianQC:. BrianQC currently only handles the C1 molecular symmetry point group. Thus, if; the molecule has any symmetries (which PSI4 would detect by default), the; input geometry must contain the line symmetry c1 to force PSI4 to; disregard the symmetry. To achieve peak performance, the following settings are recommended when enabling; BrianQC:. By default, PSI4 uses density-fitted preiterations for SCF, which BrianQC; doesn’t handle yet. To ensure that no non-BrianQC-accelerated iterations are; performed, disable the preiterations by setting DF_SCF_GUESS to False.; By default, PSI4 uses a disk-based Fock building, but BrianQC currently only; accelerate
author: psi4

sentence: uired; precision. In particular, BrianQC will respect all of PSI4’s usual precision; parameters, like INTS_TOLERANCE and E_CONVERGENCE.; BrianQC can speed up a number of internal computations, including Fock and; gradient computation. Thus, BrianQC will speed up any calculation involving; those terms, such as. HF and DFT single point energies; HF and DFT geometry optimizations; HF and DFT frequency analysis. Note that not every term of every calculation can be handled by BrianQC, thus,; the actual speedup depends on the specifics of the calculation. Necessary and recommended option values¶; To ensure that a calculation works with BrianQC, the following options need to; be set when enabling BrianQC:. BrianQC currently only handles the C1 molecular symmetry point group. Thus, if; the molecule has any symmetries (which PSI4 would detect by default), the; input geometry must contain the line symmetry c1 to force PSI4 to; disregard the symmetry. To achieve peak performance, the following settings are recommended when enabling; BrianQC:. By default, PSI4 uses density-fitted preiterations for SCF, which BrianQC; doesn’t handle yet. To ensure that no non-BrianQC-accelerated iterations are; performed, disable the preiterations by setting DF_SCF_GUESS to False.; By default, PSI4 uses a disk-based Fock building, but BrianQC currently only; accelerates direct Fock builds. To ensure that Fock building is accelerated by; BrianQC, set SCF_TYPE to direct. Keywords¶. BRIANQC_ENABLE¶. Whether to enable using the BrianQC GPU module. Type: boolean; Default: false. Environment Variables¶. BRIANQC_SDK_INSTALL¶; Toggle for type of BrianQC installation.; See https://s3.amazonaws.com/streamnovation-brianqc-manual/BrianQC_Manual_v1_1_0.pdf for details. BRIANQC_INSTALL_PATH¶; Location of BrianQC installation.; See https://s3.amazonaws.com/streamnovation-brianqc-manual/BrianQC_Manual_v1_1_0.pdf for details. BRIANQC_ENABLE¶; Runtime toggle of whether to use BrianQC. table of contents. Interface

To ensure that no non-BrianQC-accelerated iterations are; performed, disable the preiterations by setting DF_SCF_GUESS to False.; By default, PSI4 uses a disk-based Fock building, but BrianQC currently only; accelerates direct Fock builds. author: psi4
